create_order_of_transaction_refused.label: Criar pedido quando houver transação recusada

create_pending_invoice.label: Create a pending invoice (only for manual capture)

unholdorder.label: Enable Unhold Order
unholdorder.tooltip: If an order is holded for some reason but it received a notification that the payment is processed this will automatically unhold the order

autorefundoncancel.label: Automatic cancel\refund when a order is canceled

send_update_mail.label: Customers receive order status update email (deprecated).

use_zero_auth.label: Do not perform a full authorisation, only a zero auth to check if the card is valid

base_zero_auth_on_date.label: Base zero authentication vs. full authentication on the date field
base_zero_auth_on_date.tooltip: Full authentication is only valid for 7 days, after that it expires. The value here should be the date column name in 'sales_flat_order' on which the order will be shipped and thus captured.

multiple_merchants.label: Allow multiple merchants
multiple_merchants.tooltip: Allow notifications sent from other Mozg merchant accounts. Keep in mind that the Notification user name and password should be the same for all the merchant accounts

event_queue_limit.label: Process Notification Queue Limit
event_queue_limit.tooltip: What is the maximum amount of payment notifications to process during a cron run?

mozg_cielo_billing_agreements.label: Advanced: Billing Agreements
mozg_cielo_billing_agreements.comment:
ONECLICK: The shopper opts in to storing their card details for future use. The shopper is present for the subsequent transaction, for cards the security code (CVC/CVV) is required.

RECURRING*: Payment details are stored for future use. For cards, the security code (CVC/CVV) is not required for subsequent payments.

ONECLICK, RECURRING*: Payment details are stored for future use. This allows the use of the stored payment details regardless of whether the shopper is on your site or not.

recurringtypes.label: Agreement Type
recurringtypes.tooltip: When enabled, users can save their Credit Cards and their SEPA authorizations. ONECLICK will require the input of the CVC for subsequent payments, while RECURRING does not.

mozg_cielo_manual_review.label: Advanced: Manual Review
mozg_cielo_manual_review.comment: Mozg's Risk analysis tool allows merchants to configure when a transaction should be rejected or accepted depending on certain characteristics of the payment. This process has always had two automatic outcomes, either accept or reject the payment. Now, Mozg's risk system can tell merchants when a transaction seems to be risky but without rejecting it, and requires to be manually reviewed in order to decide if it should be accepted or rejected.

mozg_cielo_split_payments.label: Advanced: Split Payments
mozg_cielo_split_payments.comment: It is possible to do split payments with GiftCards please configure here what refund strategie you want to use

enable_moto.label: Enable MOTO 'Mail Order / Telephone Order' for backend orders

installments.label: Installments default
installments.comments: This is the fallback if specific credit card type has no installments configured

mozg_cielo_api_oneclick.label: Cielo OneClick - Requires Cielo Credit Card

active.label: Enabled
active.tooltip: OneClick payments only work if you have Mozg Credit Card enabled

sort_order.label: Sort Order
sort_order.tooltip: Set the sequence number of this payment method in the checkout. Payment methods with a higher sort order number will be displayed lower in the list.

recurring_payment_type.label: Agreement Type
recurring_payment_type.tooltip: With ONECLICK the shopper needs to fill in their security code for credit cards. For RECURRING, this is not needed. If you want to use RECURRING make sure you have Agreement Type set to RECURRING or ONECLICK,RECURRING. In the Backend always recurring is used because OneClick could trigger 3D secure.
